intro: Serratula heterophylla subsp. nudicaulis, commonly known as the nakedstalk sowthistle, is a herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in sunny environments. The plant has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a loose, branched inflorescence. It is known for its rapid growth and ability to colonize disturbed areas.
